title: Is Now the Time to Buy ServiceNow? Yes, and Here's Our Plan of Action
text:
ServiceNow (NOW) has gotten its technical act together and looks like it can make an assault on its July zenith. The stock survived a test of the rising 200-day moving average line earlier this month and now prices are knocking on an upside breakout.

In this daily bar chart of NOW, below, we can see the success test of the rising 200-day moving average line. Prices are above the declining/bottoming 50-day moving average line and prices are in position to test/break the highs of August and September.

The On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line has been slowly inching upwards from early September signaling a quiet or slow shift to more aggressive buying.

The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator has also been improving from the middle of August and we are now just below the zero line and an outright go long signal.

In this weekly bar chart of NOW, below, we we can see a chart in transformation. Prices are back above the rising 40-week moving average line.

The weekly OBV line has been steady the past two months which is okay but a rising line is preferred.

The MACD oscillator is in a take profits mode above the zero line but it has been narrowing and a fresh buy signal could be in the offing in the near future.

In this Point and Figure chart of NOW, below, the pattern is clear. Prices have hammered out a base and a trade at $276.93 will be an upside breakout. A possible $316 price target is being projected.

Bottom line strategy: Traders could go long NOW at current levels risking below $250. Add on strength above $277. The $300 area and then $315 are our price targets.
